data.title: Diversity Equity and Inclusion
data.meta_description: Diversity Equity and Inclusion - Nardin Academy
data.text:
DEI is not a trend, buzz word, benchmark, or an end goal. It is a way of being and doing. This concept guides the work of the DEI office at Nardin academy. The work of advancing diversity, equity and inclusion is about how every person is seen, valued, and treated with dignity. It is how we honor our shared humanity.

We must not only define these words, we must also be vigilant in our commitment to build and sustain a community that embraces it. Nardin is one of those communities.

Over the past year we have accomplished a lot. And we are just getting started,yet recognize there is still much to do. We are proud to share some of our accomplishments in the 2023-2023 school year:

Formed an all academy DEI committee formed

Participated in 3 diverse learning experiences with students beyond the academy walls

Celebrated Pride month

Fundraised $5133.60 for social justice organizations

Held prayer service in memory of the 5/14 Tops massacre with the entire Nardin community

Partnered with Say Yes Buffalo as a sponsor for a city wide DEI conference

Highlighted student insights on woman’s day on social media

Focused on learning more about the vast cultures at Nardin

Delivered introduction to DEI for 4,5,6,7 and 8th graders

Won two of the top 3 prizes at the Urban League MLK writing contest, and 11 honorable mentions

Attended a DEO train the trainer conference at UB, with 16 students completing

Received 3 Urban Urban Leadership Learning Community scholarship spearhead by the Guidance office

Created Community Engagement scholarship for graduating DEI champions with gifts from our families

I am genuinely excited about the possibilities that lie ahead of us. Together

your voice, your ideas and your engagement are vital to us as we continue to shape Nardin Academy into an even more vibrant and inclusive institution. I invite you to join us on our mission. Diversity, equity and inclusion are everyone’s responsibility; we need your help and appreciate your support. I welcome your feedback at kbrown@nardin.org

Visit our website often to keep up with updates.
